column4: U.S. drillers add oil rigs for 12th week in a row -Baker Hughes
column5: April 7 U.S. drillers added oil rigs for a 12th week in a row  extending the recovery into an 11th month as energy companies boost spending on new production to take advantage of a recovery in crude prices.     Drillers added 10 oil rigs in the week to April 7  bringing the total count up to 672  the most since August 2015  energy services firm Baker Hughes Inc         said on Friday.       During the same week a year ago  there were 354 active oil rigs.
